thread.title_full: Golden Globe Awards 2024: Live coverage, red carpet and winners | The Canberra Times | Canberra, ACT

author: Anna McGuinness
title: Golden Globe Awards 2024: Live coverage, red carpet and winners | The Canberra Times | Canberra, ACT
text: \u003ci\u003e\u003c/i\u003eAustralian actresses Sarah Snook and Elizabeth Debicki have both scored wins at the 2024 Golden Globe Awards on January 8. Snook won her second Golden Globe for hit drama \u003ci\u003eSuccession,\u003c/i\u003e this time for best actress in a drama series. Meanwhile Debicki's portrayal of Princess Diana in \u003ci\u003eThe Crown\u003c/i\u003e saw her take out the best supporting actress in a TV series at the Beverly Hills awards night. \u003cbr\u003eHowever \u003ci\u003eBarbie \u003c/i\u003estar Margot Robbie was pipped by Emma Stone for best actress in a comedy or musical.The 2023 blockbuster went into the night with nine nominations but could only bring home two, for cinematic and box office achievement and the original song, \u003ci\u003eWhat Was I Made For?\u003c/i\u003eIn television \u003ci\u003eSuccession\u003c/i\u003e's final season earned the series four wins from nine nominations, followed by \u003ci\u003eThe Bear \u003c/i\u003eand \u003ci\u003eBeef \u003c/i\u003ewith three wins each.The 81\u003csup\u003est\u003c/sup\u003e Golden Globe Awards are in Los Angeles, California from 11am AEDT on January 8 and are broadcast live on streaming service Stan. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eBest Director - Motion Picture\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eBest Motion Picture - Animated\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eBest Motion Picture - Drama\u003c/b\u003e\u003cb\u003eBest Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy\u003c/b\u003e\u003cb\u003eBest Motion Picture - Non-English Language\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eBest Original Score - Motion Picture\u003c/b\u003e\u003cb\u003eBest Original Song - Motion Picture\u003c/b\u003e\u003cb\u003eBest Performance By A Female Actor In A Limited Series, Anthology Series, Or A Motion Picture Made For Television\u003c/b\u003e\u003cb\u003eBest Performance By A Female Actor In A Motion Picture - Drama\u003c/b\u003e\u003cb\u003eBest Performance By A Female Actor In A Motion Picture - Musical Or Comedy\u003c/b\u003e\u003cb\u003eBest Performance By A Female Actor In A Supporting Role In Any Motion Picture\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003eBest Performance By A Female Actor In A Supporting Role On Television\u003c/b\u003e\u003cb\u003eBest Performance By A Female Actor In A Television Series - Musical Or Comedy\u003c/b\u003e\u003cb\u003eBest Performance By A Female Actor In A Television Series - Drama\u003c/b\u003e\u003cb\u003eBest Performance By A Male Actor In A Limited Series, Anthology Series, Or A Motion Picture Made For Television\u003c/b\u003e\u003cb\u003eBest Performance By A Male Actor In A Motion Picture - Drama\u003c/b\u003e\u003cb\u003eBest Performance By A Male Actor In A Motion Picture - Musical Or Comedy\u003c/b\u003e\u003cb\u003eBest Performance By A Male Actor In A Supporting Role In Any Motion Picture\u003c/b\u003e\u003cb\u003eBest Performance By A Male Actor In A Supporting Role On Television\u003c/b\u003e\u003cb\u003eBest Performance By A Male Actor In A Television Series - Musical Or Comedy\u003c/b\u003e\u003cb\u003eBest Performance By A Male Actor In A Television Series - Drama\u003c/b\u003e\u003cb\u003eBest Performance In Stand-Up Comedy On Television\u003c/b\u003e\u003cb\u003eBest Screenplay - Motion Picture\u003c/b\u003e\u003cb\u003eBest Television Limited Series, Anthology Series, or Motion Picture Made for Television\u003c/b\u003e\u003cb\u003eBest Television Series - Musical or Comedy\u003c/b\u003e\u003cb\u003eBest Television Series - Drama\u003c/b\u003e\u003cb\u003eCinematic and Box Office Achievement\u003c/b\u003e
